etymology.description: pictogram (象形): crack in an oracle bone used for divination.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts the branching crack made on turtle shell or bone during pyromancy, whose patterns were read as omens. The simple vertical line with a side notch mirrors the appearance of such fissures.

examples.chinese: 我们请他卜一卦(我們請他卜一卦)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qǐng tā bǔ yī guà.
examples.english: We asked him to divine a hexagram.

examples.chinese: 他会卜吉凶(他會卜吉凶)。
examples.english: He can divine whether things will be auspicious or inauspicious.

examples.chinese: 用龟甲卜问前途(用龜甲卜問前途)。
examples.english: They use turtle shells to divine the future.
